title: Print, "The Buddha: "I was led unto the schools.  I knew more than the teachers."", 1895
medium: Lithograph, black ink on India paper
description: Vertical rectangle.  A figure, seated, left, facing the spectator.  The head and figure are in shadow, only the left shoulder and the edge of the drapery covering the right knee, catching the light radiating from the sphere suspended near the center of the composition.  Inscription in margin, in pencil, lower right: "a Monsieur Marc Haven."

tombstone.epitaph: Print, "The Buddha: "I was led unto the schools.  I knew more than the teachers."", 1895. Lithograph, black ink on India paper. 1953-8-1.
